title: cuda.XxxTensor.inverse, svd ... raise errors at even times
body_html:
I think this is a bug in magma, it happens like this

In [69]: x = torch.rand(5, 3)

In [70]: cx = x.cuda()

In [71]: a = cx.svd()

In [72]: a = cx.svd()
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-72-e5183868ee83> in <module>()
----> 1 a = cx.svd()

RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (8) : invalid device function at /data/users/soumith/miniconda2/conda-bld/pytorch-0.1.8_1486038465652/work/torch/lib/THC/THCTensorCopy.cu:204

...

In [81]: a = cx.svd()

In [82]: a = cx.svd()
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-83-e5183868ee83> in <module>()
----> 1 a = cx.svd()

RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (8) : invalid device function at /data/users/soumith/miniconda2/conda-bld/pytorch-0.1.8_1486038465652/work/torch/lib/THC/THCTensorCopy.cu:204

I confirmed that

  • odd times results are fine. they are equal to cpu results.
  • torch.cuda.has_magma == True
  • also this can be happened in a = torch.svd(cx) style
  • this error doesn't appear at non-lapack functions torch.cos, torch.sin

my enviroment is

  • Python3.6 (anaconda3-4.3.0)
  • CUDA8.0
  • GTX1080
  • CentOS6.5

body:
I think this is a bug in magma, it happens like this

```
In [69]: x = torch.rand(5, 3)

In [70]: cx = x.cuda()

In [71]: a = cx.svd()

In [72]: a = cx.svd()
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-72-e5183868ee83> in <module>()
----> 1 a = cx.svd()

RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (8) : invalid device function at /data/users/soumith/miniconda2/conda-bld/pytorch-0.1.8_1486038465652/work/torch/lib/THC/THCTensorCopy.cu:204

...

In [81]: a = cx.svd()

In [82]: a = cx.svd()
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-83-e5183868ee83> in <module>()
----> 1 a = cx.svd()

RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (8) : invalid device function at /data/users/soumith/miniconda2/conda-bld/pytorch-0.1.8_1486038465652/work/torch/lib/THC/THCTensorCopy.cu:204
```

I confirmed that
+ odd times results are fine. they are equal to cpu results.
+ `torch.cuda.has_magma == True`
+ also this can be happened in `a = torch.svd(cx)` style
+ this error doesn't appear at non-lapack functions `torch.cos, torch.sin`

my enviroment is
+ Python3.6 (anaconda3-4.3.0)
+ CUDA8.0
+ GTX1080
+ CentOS6.5
